intro: Epilobium fastigiatum, commonly known as the upright willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink or purple flowers are arranged in dense spikes and bloom in late summer. Epilobium fastigiatum is often found in wet meadows, streambanks, and other damp habitats.
